title: Week 3: January 12–18 - Genesis 1–2; Moses 2–3; Abraham 4–5

# Week 3: Jesus Created the World—We Are Made in God's Image

## Lesson Overview
This lesson teaches children that Jesus Christ created the beautiful world under Heavenly Father's direction (Moses 2:1–25) and that we are created in God's image, male and female (Genesis 1:26–27; Moses 2:26–27). It also highlights how God blessed the Sabbath day as holy (Genesis 2:2–3). For 8-10-year-olds, these truths build gratitude for creation, self-respect for their divine potential, and simple ways to honor the Sabbath.

## Opening Activity (5 minutes): Chaos to Creation Object Lesson
**Activity Type**: Object Lessons  
Gather everyday items like socks, toys, blocks, and paper in a big messy pile on the floor or table. Ask, "What does this look like? Messy and empty, right?" (Like earth "without form, and void" in Genesis 1:2.) Quickly organize them into a fun tower or picture. Say, "Just like Jesus organized the earth from nothing into something beautiful!"  
**Materials**: Household messy items, basket.  
**Connection**: Shows how Jesus created order and beauty (Moses 2:1–25).  
**Discussion**: "How does this make you feel about Jesus?"

## Scripture Focus
**Key Verse 1**: Genesis 1:26–27 – "And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness... So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them."  
*Child-friendly*: Heavenly Father and Jesus made us to look like Them and act kindly like Them—we are special!  

**Key Verse 2**: Genesis 2:2–3 – "And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made. And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it."  
*Child-friendly*: After creating everything good, God made Sunday special and holy to rest and worship.

## Main Activities (15-20 minutes total)

### 1. Creation Sing-Along March (5 minutes)
**Activity Type**: Music & Movement  
1. Teach "My Heavenly Father Loves Me" (Children’s Songbook, 228–29).  
2. Sing while marching around the room: Add actions—point to sky for "heavenly Father," hug self for "loves me," touch eyes/nose/mouth for body parts Jesus created.  
3. Pause to name creations: "What did Jesus make on day 4? (Stars, moon!)"  
**Materials**: Song lyrics printed or projected (optional).  
**Connection**: Celebrates Jesus creating the world and our bodies (Genesis 1:1–25; Moses 2:1–25).  
**Discussion**: "What in the song shows God's love? How do you feel His creations?"

### 2. Image of God Body Puzzles (5-7 minutes)
**Activity Type**: Hands-On Crafts  
1. Give each child a paper outline of a simple body (head, arms, legs).  
2. Let them draw/color their face, hair, clothes—showing they are made in God's image.  
3. Cut into 4-6 puzzle pieces; trade with a friend to reassemble.  
4. As they put together, say, "We fit perfectly because Heavenly Father designed us!"  
**Materials**: Paper body outlines (pre-drawn), crayons, scissors.  
**Connection**: Teaches we are created "in the image of God" male and female (Moses 2:26–27).  
**Discussion**: "Why is your body sacred? How can you thank God for it?"

### 3. Holy Sabbath Choices Relay (5 minutes)
**Activity Type**: Physical Activities & Games  
1. Set up two sides of room: "Holy Sabbath" station (pictures of church, family prayer, scripture reading) and "Other Days" station (toys, TV, shopping).  
2. Divide into teams; on "Go," child runs to choose one card/picture from "Holy Sabbath" pile, brings back, next goes.  
3. Review choices together.  
**Materials**: Printed pictures or drawn cards (church, pray, play soccer).  
**Connection**: God "blessed and sanctified" the seventh day (Moses 3:2–3)—we choose holy activities.  
**Discussion**: "What makes Sunday different? How does it show love for Jesus?"

## Testimony Time (3 minutes)
Gather in a circle. Ask, "What do you feel when you think of Jesus creating you and the world?" Invite 2-3 children to share simply, like "I feel happy" or "I know He loves me." Share your own: "I love seeing mountains and know Jesus made them for us."

## Take-Home Challenge
Draw one thing Jesus created (like a flower or your hand) and tell your family, "Jesus made this—thank You!" (Genesis 1:1–25).

## Teacher Tips
- Time activities with a timer to keep energy high; adapt crafts for smaller groups by partnering kids.  
- If short on space, do relay as stand/sit choices: Thumbs up for holy Sabbath ideas.
